New Records: Quinton de Kock surpassed India's Virat Kohli for the most runs in this World Cup
Quinton de Kock surpassed Australia's David Warner for the highest individual score in this World Cup
Heinrich Klaasen's 90 off 49 balls is a significant individual performance
Key Match Events: Marco Jansen took two crucial wickets in the seventh over, dismissing Tanzid Hasan (12) and Najmul Hossain Shanto (0) caught behind
Lizaad Williams removed Shakib Al Hasan (1) in the next over
Kagiso Rabada trapped Litton Das (12) leg-before
Mehidy Hasan Miraz (11) was sent in at No. 7 and was eventually dismissed by Keshav Maharaj (1/32)
Mahmudullah played a remarkable innings, scoring a century and forming crucial partnerships to reduce the margin of defeat
Quinton de Kock's record knock of 174 and Heinrich Klaasen's explosive 90 off just 49 balls highlighted South Africa's formidable batting strength
South Africa posted a mammoth total of 382 for 5 in the group stage match
South Africa exploded in the final 10 overs to score another 144 runs, led by David Miller's unbeaten 15-ball 34
Markram batted fluently for his 67-ball 60, moving his hands deftly to score seven boundaries
An inside-out lofted drive found Das at long-on off Shakib in the 31st over, with the Proteas' third wicket stand scoring 131 runs
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh suffered their third-largest defeat in World Cup history
Bangladesh fell to their fourth straight loss so far
South Africa leapfrogged New Zealand to jump to the second spot in the World Cup 2023 points table
